content:
Yes, it is concerning that the media often seems to view child actors solely as commodities, as opposed to real children with feelings, needs, and families. This type of objectification can be deeply damaging to the mental health and self-esteem of the child actors, among other negative effects.

As with any issue, change can take time, but there are steps that can be taken to address this problem. One important step is education and awareness of the issue. By bringing attention to the harms that can result from the media's mistreatment of child actors, we can encourage people to take action to prevent it.

Other steps that can be taken include implementing stricter laws and regulations to protect child actors, and empowering them and their advocates to speak out and take action against harmful media practices. It is crucial for everyone to work together to create a safer environment for child actors and ensure that they are not treated as mere commodities.
